title: 111_s3810
content: The Act is titled the "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" and includes a restriction on participation in offshore oil and gas leasing. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" mandates that leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf require annual certification from the lessee to ensure compliance with sanctions against Iran. Failure to certify or providing false information may result in lease cancellation. The "Gulf Security and Iran Sanctions Enforcement Act" requires annual certification from lessees for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf to comply with sanctions against Iran. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel the lease if the certification is false or not provided. Additionally, the Secretary must include a disclosure requirement in each lease issued after the Act's enactment. The Secretary of the Interior must include a disclosure requirement in leases for drilling on the Outer Continental Shelf, mandating lessees to disclose any involvement in energy-related ventures outside Iran with individuals blocked under Executive Order 13224. Persons or entities whose property is blocked under Executive Orders related to terrorism, weapons of mass destruction proliferation, or Iranian transactions regulations are prohibited from transacting with individuals involved in energy-related ventures outside Iran. The Secretary can cancel a lease if a person fails to disclose involvement with blocked entities related to terrorism, weapons of mass destruction proliferation, or Iranian transactions regulations. The Secretary of the Interior may waive this requirement. The Secretary, in consultation with other departments, can cancel a lease if disclosure requirements are not met or false. The Secretary of the Interior has the authority to waive this requirement on a case-by-case basis if it is in the national interest, with reporting obligations on waivers granted. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel a lease if disclosure requirements are not met or false, with the authority to waive this requirement on a case-by-case basis in the national interest. Reporting obligations on waivers granted must be submitted to appropriate congressional committees. Any lease cancellations must be promptly reported with reasons to the same committees. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. The Secretary of the Interior can cancel a lease if disclosure requirements are not met or false, with the authority to waive this requirement on a case-by-case basis in the national interest. Reporting obligations on waivers granted must be submitted to specific congressional committees. The term "appropriate congressional committees" refers to specific committees in the House of Representatives and the Senate. SEC. 3. SUNSET. This Act will end 30 days after the President certifies to Congress that Iran has permanently stopped supporting terrorism, pursuing weapons of mass destruction, and no longer poses a significant threat to the US.
